Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; traces of two faded added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of underbelly, with patterned decoration and added red patches, genitals and hind leg of bull, to right; part of elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the bull, see one of the two Würzburg chalices in Lemos 1991, pl. 20, no. 236 from Vulci.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0444) (phase 2)
